field.name: Tips to care for a child with sickle cell disease:
Feed child well. Give only breastmilk for the first 6 months of life for protection against infections
After 6 months give child other foods in addition to breastmilk until he or she is 2 years of age
Protect child from cold, and do NOT give food or drinks that is cold or iced
Let child under an ITN every night
Give child daily folic acid and other medicines prescribed by your health worker
Do not give iron tablets or syrup except when prescribed by your health worker
Give child a lot of fluids to drink
Always use warm water to bathe child
Keep all appointments with your health worker even if child is well
